result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
15CF185, 257 Defendant Tyrone H Richmond in court with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Terry w/draws her motion.  Court reviews charges and penalties, def pleads no contest, court finds plea made FVKI, court accepts plea and finds def guilty, remaining counts are DRI, 15CF257 is DRI, state heard, defense counsel heard, defendant makes statement, court heard and sentence imposed.  Atty Terry requests a few days to get a credit slip.  So ordered

w/held
30 months probation
2 mo DCJ w/huber and transer to comm on or before 2/11/16
maintain full time employment
engage in treatment as recommended by the agent
court costs and supervision fees
$878 seized at arrest, not contraband, $350 to be turned over to DC Sheriff's dept to drug task force as buy money, $528 remainder is forfeited to clerk of courts for costs
additional money seized on the defendant date of arrest shall be turned over to be considered contraband WI School fund

ADDRESS INFO for Tyrone H Richmond
Current: 2533 N. 27th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 01-27-2016)
Prior: 112 Lakecrest Drive - #205, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

Motion hearing at 02-04-2016 01:30 pm.
Jury trial at 02-24-2016 08:30 am.

15CF185 & 15CF257 - Defendant Tyrone H Richmond in court with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Tyrone H Richmond not in court. Prosecuting Atty James T. Sempf appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Catherine Jane Terry in court for Defendant Tyrone H Richmond. Atty Terry heard on def's FTA for prelim hrg; Defendant now appears late; State calls Officer Randy Mantych, sworn & testifies; Court finds prob cause;  Arraignment scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

Defendant Tyrone H Richmond in custody via video with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller (will appoint on both cases).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. State requests $20,000 CASH bond; Atty. Moeller response; Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 7/30/15 at 1:30pm in Br. 4; Court sets $2,000 CASH Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
